DOC.brief_summary: Despite intermittent control of tracheal cuff pressure using a manual manometer, cuff underinflation and overinflation frequently occur in critically ill patients, resulting in increased risk for microaspiration and tracheal ischemic lesions.
DOC.brief_title: Efficiency of a Mechanical Device in Controlling Tracheal Cuff Pressure in Intubated Critically Ill Patients
DOC.detailed_description: The aim of this study is to determine the efficiency of Pressure easyÂ® device (Smiths medical cuff pressure controller) in continuous control of tracheal cuff pressure.
DOC.criteria: Patients intubated in the ICU with a polyvinyl chloride (PVC) cuffed tracheal tube. Predicted duration of mechanical ventilation > or = 48h. Age > or = 18 years. Signed informed consent. Anticipated duration of mechanical ventilation<48h after randomization. Tracheostomized patients. Patients with contraindication for semirecumbent position. Patients participating to another trial that might influence this study results.
